channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti. Broken Planters. Leaves. Litter, 26th October
item.description:
The whole of Angell Road and Angell Park Gardens needs a good clean. There are leaves all over pavements, weeds, blocked drains, broken, overgrown planters on the corner of Overton Road and Angell Park Gardens, graffiti on the Loughborough Estate Sign, fly-posters and graffiti on the phonebox, stickers and graffiti over the Angell Road sign, and the notice board on the junction with Barrington Road is covered in graffiti and fly posters.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overton Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several dog waste bags, 26th October
item.description:
Several more dog waste bags have been left in the alleyway since it was last cleaned up. Appears to be the same person as the bags are the same as last time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in the alleyway, 26th October
item.description:
Lots of bulky waste items have been left in this alley way several weeks (maybe even months) ago. It’s a massive eyesore for those who access their properties via this alley. Additionally there is an overflowing commercial bin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webb Street, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: 2 inch deep pothole opposite Coop Streatham Hill., 26th October
item.description:
Recent construction and limited room for going around the pothole. Pothole seems to be a square cutout left by construction crew. About 2 inches deep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sternhold Avenue, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside of 219 Kilburn lane, 26th October
item.description:
There is rubbish constantly on Kilburn lane, every single day. Every day I walk outside my door there is someone’s bin contents on my door step. The council tax is one of the highest in London and due to this we expect our streets to be clean. I have attached pictures of today’s mess on the street, but it is like this every single day. Please please can something be done about this? I believe it is because some houses do not have wheely bins so they have to put their bin bags on the street and foxes get into them, then the wind blows the rubbish everywhere. This has been an issue since I moved here last December

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Lane, North Kensington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped sofa and other materials, 26th October
item.description:
Sofa was dumped 3 weeks ago and needs to be removed. Located next to recycling bins in from of John Brent block

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bush Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fox - health risk, 26th October
item.description:
A fox consistently manages to get into the basement of Berkeley Court. There are children that have access to the basement. The fox might bite someone if it feels threatened in a confined space risking giving rabies. Foxes also spread disease. Its climbing all over the vehicles in the basement and has been leaving its pee and other waste all over the cars and everywhere in the basement. This can be a health risk for the residents. In addition, there is further risk of eating cables under the vehicle that can have life risking consequences. Ive asked the building management to do something about this but over a year later they have done nothing and now the fox is more at ease to keep returning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glentworth Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near Hodge House, 26th October
item.description:
See incident FixMyStreet ref: 8188346 This issue has become worse because it has been neglected. There is now a serious health and safety risk as a result of paving slabs being lifted up. Given that it is coming into the autumn, this will become an increasingly bigger trip hazard if not sorted ASAP. Please read the recommendations on the referenced report.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Towardsthe top of the hill, 26th October
item.description:
Cycling and climbing up. With a green light I couldn't make it to the top without traffic coming the other way. No pavement or enough room to get out of the way. Accident waiting to happen. Only a matter of time!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Road, West Hampstead, London

item.title: Traffic Lights Pointing the Wrong Way REMAINS UNFIXED AFTER 1 MONTH !!!, 26th October
item.description:
Contrary to the email you sent me yesterday: -------------------------------------------------- New updates on Traffic lights not facing the right way The action scheduled for your report should now have been completed as detailed in your previous response. On some occasions it does take a little longer than scheduled. If you have any further queries on this, please either create a new report or contact our Customer Contact Centre on 0343 222 1234 State changed to: Fixed TfL -------------------------------------------------- NO WORK HAS BEEN UNDERTAKEN TO ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM, AS I HAVE JUST DRIVEN PAST IT. SO AFTER ONE MONTH IT REMAINS A DANGEROUS JUNCTION - GET IT FIXED
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Builders material etc dumped round tree, 26th October
item.description:
Builders working in immediate vicinity have dumped bags, buckets, materials etc around base of tree. Packaging shows addresses. Please investigate and prosecute. This is shameless, blatant flytipping and a real eye-sore. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince of Wales Drive, Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped caravan, 26th October
item.description:
It’s been reported by people already but still the council do nothing about it. A dumped caravan, but not only a dumped caravan there is someone living in it as well. Surly something needs to be done about that how can the be safe for people around the area that there can be some strange bloke living in a dodgy caravan.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middle Park Avenue, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
